evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root

slot_statements.availability: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the historical preliminary phase on 12-25.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA case on 12-25 withstands alternative explanations and remains a valid root cause in the historical preliminary context.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with the key features identified for the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25 in the historical preliminary data.

slot_statements.availability: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is documented and available in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 historical preliminary data.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The identification of procedural deviation in pushback execution is robust against potential defeaters, supported by consistent evidence within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 historical preliminary records.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The procedural deviation in pushback execution aligns with key features observed in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 historical preliminary dataset, reflecting typical deviations encountered during pushback operations.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the historical preliminary phase on 12-25.

assumptions: Communication via interphone and observed coordination imply no significant communication breakdown.
The incident is better explained by procedural deviation than by communication failure.
defeaters: If evidence showed explicit communication failures or misunderstandings among crew during the pushback phase.
If the headset operator or crew failed to coordinate or respond appropriately.

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.
After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H4 shows active communication and coordination between crew and tug operators, with procedural deviation (pushback beyond TRP) rather than a communication breakdown causing the incident.
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in interpreting whether the pushback beyond TRP was due to communication failure or procedural deviation.

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is documented and available in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 historical preliminary data.

defeaters: If documentation or explicit reference to procedural deviation records in the specified historical preliminary data were provided, this would change the assessment.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided history explicitly documents or confirms availability of procedural deviation documentation in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 historical preliminary data.

slot_statements.availability: The environmental or marking deficiency must be present and identifiable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the historical preliminary timeframe of 12-25.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The identification of the environmental or marking deficiency must be robust against potential counterarguments or evidence that could negate its presence or significance in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the historical preliminary period of 12-25.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The environmental or marking deficiency should align with the key features and characteristics relevant to the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA model and its operational context during the specified timeframe.

node.statement: The environmental or marking deficiency must be present and identifiable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the historical preliminary timeframe of 12-25.

defeaters: If evidence showed the TRP markings were missing, obscured, or misleading during the timeframe, that would support environmental deficiency.

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H4 shows the aircraft moved beyond the marked Tug release point, indicating no environmental or marking deficiency was present or identifiable; this supports procedural deviation over environmental deficiency.

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution aligns with key features observed in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 historical preliminary dataset, reflecting typical deviations encountered during pushback operations.

assumptions: No mechanical control failure evidence is present; procedural deviation is inferred from operator actions and event sequence.
defeaters: If evidence showed equipment fault traces or bench checks indicating control malfunction, the conclusion would change.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with the key features identified for the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25 in the historical preliminary data.

defeaters: If evidence showed clear, effective communication and coordination preventing the incident
If mechanical failure was the primary cause rather than communication breakdown

slot_statements.availability: Mechanical/control failure was present in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25 during hist_t0_prelim.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: Mechanical/control failure is resistant to defeaters based on the evidence from the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25 during hist_t0_prelim.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: Mechanical/control failure fits the key features observed in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25 during hist_t0_prelim.

node.statement: Mechanical/control failure was present in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25 during hist_t0_prelim.

assumptions: No direct mechanical fault evidence is present in the provided history.
Procedural deviations and environmental factors are more strongly supported by the evidence than mechanical failure.
defeaters: Direct evidence of mechanical or control system malfunction such as fault codes, bench checks, or repeated malfunctions would change the assessment.
Physical evidence of equipment fault or verified control system failure.

quotes.exact_quote: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H3 shows operator procedural actions and decisions during pushback, indicating human procedural deviation rather than mechanical failure; H4 shows the aircraft moved beyond the TRP, consistent with procedural or environmental factors rather than confirmed mechanical/control failure.
